greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Expansion of (1-4*x)/(1-2*x+4*x^2).
comment: Hankel transform of A128014(n+1). Binomial transform of A128019.
Hankel transform of A002426(n+1). - _Paul Barry_, Mar 15 2008
Hankel transform of A007971(n+1). [From _Paul Barry_, Sep 30 2009]
Hankel transform of A103970 is a(n)/4^C(n+1,2). [From _Paul Barry_, Nov 20 2009]
The real part of Q^(n+1), where Q is the quaternion 1+i+j+k. - Stanislav Sykora, Jun 11 2012.
link: G. C. Greubel, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..1000
Index entries for linear recurrences with constant coefficients, signature (2,-4).
formula: G.f.: G(0)/(2*x)-1/x, where G(k)= 1 + 1/(1 - x*(3*k+1)/(x*(3*k+4) + 1/G(k+1))); (continued fraction). - _Sergei N. Gladkovskii_, May 27 2013
mathematica: CoefficientList[Series[(1 - 4*x)/(1 - 2*x + 4*x^2), {x,0,50}], x] (* or *) LinearRecurrence[{2,-4},{1,-2},50] (* _G. C. Greubel_, Feb 28 2017 *)
results.author: _Paul Barry_, Feb 11 2007
